page.title: 19RECREATION-GOLF CLUB
page.content: {Recreation}in Forfar includes a 109 acre 18 hole{golf course}1 mile out of the town. The course is one of the best in the district and compares favourably with most others, while the catering in the clubhouse is infinitely superior to most. Forfar golf course was opened on 6 September 1871 when permission to play on Auchterforfar Moor was granted. The undulating nature of the ground, due to the previous flax cultivation, makes it a challenging course for even the best players. The course is presently run by 20 people, 4 of whom do the manual{work}around the course. On average the greens are cut twice a week but this increases during warmer months.At present there are about 1000 members mostly from Forfar. It has increased dramatically in recent years.
